title: Calories in No Bake Cookies
meta_description: Discover calories in no bake cookies per serving, including carbs, fat, protein, and recipe tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Standard peanut butter oatmeal no-bake cookies (~25g each), made with sugar, cocoa, peanut butter, rolled oats, milk, and butter; no nuts added.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredient brands, portion size, and add-ins. Homemade values differ from store-bought; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard no-bake cookie has about 120 calories and 2 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp chocolate chips per cookie
Use low-sugar peanut butter and reduce sugar by 25%
Vegan version with coconut oil instead of butter

faqs.q: How many calories in one no bake cookie?
faqs.a: About 120 calories for a standard peanut butter oatmeal no-bake cookie.

faqs.q: Are no bake cookies high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 9 g sugars per cookie from added sugar and ingredients.

faqs.q: What's the protein in no bake cookies?
faqs.a: Around 2 g protein per cookie, mainly from peanut butter and oats.

faqs.q: Can no bake cookies be healthy?
faqs.a: Tweaks like using less sugar or nut butters can reduce calories and boost nutrition.

faqs.q: How do calories vary in no bake cookies?
faqs.a: Depends on recipeâ€”add-ins like nuts or chocolate increase calories; smaller portions lower them.
